Falters at times: The claim falters at times because it suggests that Mike Pence moved decisively when confronted with the HIV outbreak, but evidence suggests that he did not take prompt action.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support because it does not provide sufficient evidence to back up the assertion that Pence moved decisively.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that Pence's actions were effective in addressing the HIV outbreak, when evidence suggests that earlier action could have prevented a more serious epidemic.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation presented by Pete Buttigieg, who claims that Pence was dragged into addressing the HIV outbreak and could have acted earlier to prevent the worst parts of the epidemic.
